ai.summary: Carn Brea BR 18 is a short, easy 2.3 km hike to the summit of Carn Brea, offering sweeping views and a touch of history. The route is suitable for most walkers and families, with a gentle ascent and a well-maintained path.
ai.terrain_summary: The trail runs along a compact, well-marked path of gravel and grass. Expect a few uneven sections and a short stair or two near the summit. Overall it's an easy surface with good footing, though wind and weather can make exposed areas chilly.
ai.safety_notes: Check weather before you go; wear sturdy footwear and stay on the marked path. The summit area can be windy and exposed, with uneven or rocky sections and short stairs. Bring water, a light layer, and sun protection. Be mindful of other hikers and children, and supervise dogs. Respect any conservation or heritage signs near the ruins at the top.
ai.best_seasons: Year-round, with spring and autumn offering the most comfortable temperatures and daylight.
